subject: Writing
title: Vanity Press: The Old Stigma
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Vanity Press: The Old Stigma.

hook.text: For decades, 'self-published' meant 'rejected by everyone.' Authors who paid to print their own books were shamed.

buildup.text: Vanity presses charged authors to print their books â€” no editing, no marketing, no distribution.

discovery.text: The stigma was real: bookstores wouldn't stock self-published titles, and reviewers refused to cover them.

twist.text: But some vanity press books became classics â€” Marcel Proust, Virginia Woolf, and Mark Twain all self-published.

climax.text: The old stigma assumed that gatekeepers were always right. The digital age proved they were often just slow.

punchline.text: The authors who published themselves were ahead of their time.
